title: Part a.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable funds market with equilibrium interest rate and quantity identified. (This graph can have EITHER, on the horizontal axis, all borrowed funds [government and private] OR just private sector borrowing. Either one is acceptable, but answers to the following parts of the question should be consistent with how the student begins. The student must show the equilibrium real interest rate to get the point.)
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable funds market with equilibrium interest rate and quantity identified. (This graph can have EITHER, on the horizontal axis, all borrowed funds [government and private] OR just private sector borrowing. Either one is acceptable, but answers to the following parts of the question should be consistent with how the student begins. The student must show the equilibrium real interest rate to get the point.)

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for a correctly labeled graph of the loanable funds market with equilibrium interest rate and quantity identified. (This graph can have EITHER, on the horizontal axis, all borrowed funds [government and private] OR just private sector borrowing. Either one is acceptable, but answers to the following parts of the question should be consistent with how the student begins. The student must show the equilibrium real interest rate to get the point.)

title: Part b.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that there will be a budget deficit.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve OR a leftward shift of the supply curve resulting in a higher interest rate. (The student may show the higher interest rate as a result of an increase in the demand for all funds OR as a result of fewer funds going to the private sector.)
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for stating that there will be a budget deficit.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve OR a leftward shift of the supply curve resulting in a higher interest rate. (The student may show the higher interest rate as a result of an increase in the demand for all funds OR as a result of fewer funds going to the private sector.)

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that there will be a budget deficit.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve OR a leftward shift of the supply curve resulting in a higher interest rate. (The student may show the higher interest rate as a result of an increase in the demand for all funds OR as a result of fewer funds going to the private sector.)

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that there will be a budget deficit.

  • One point is earned for showing a rightward shift of the demand curve OR a leftward shift of the supply curve resulting in a higher interest rate. (The student may show the higher interest rate as a result of an increase in the demand for all funds OR as a result of fewer funds going to the private sector.)

title: Part c.
stimulusHtml:
1 point

One point is earned for stating that the higher real interest rate will reduce consumption and investment spending (crowds out private spending).
descriptions:
No point earned.

One point is earned for stating that the higher real interest rate will reduce consumption and investment spending (crowds out private spending).

Earns 1 of 1 point.

One point is earned for stating that the higher real interest rate will reduce consumption and investment spending (crowds out private spending).

title: Part d.
stimulusHtml:
2 points

  • One point is earned for stating that the growth rate will decrease or the economy will grow at a reduced growth rate.

  • One point is earned for explaining that there will be less capital formation or less investment will slow down the growth of the capital stock.
descriptions:
No points earned.

  • One point is earned for stating that the growth rate will decrease or the economy will grow at a reduced growth rate.

  • One point is earned for explaining that there will be less capital formation or less investment will slow down the growth of the capital stock.

Earns 1 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that the growth rate will decrease or the economy will grow at a reduced growth rate.

  • One point is earned for explaining that there will be less capital formation or less investment will slow down the growth of the capital stock.

Earns 2 of 2 points.

  • One point is earned for stating that the growth rate will decrease or the economy will grow at a reduced growth rate.

  • One point is earned for explaining that there will be less capital formation or less investment will slow down the growth of the capital stock.
